articles.title: Democrats release suggestive letter to Epstein purportedly signed by Trump, which he denies
articles.description:
Trump has said he did not write the letter or create the drawing of a curvaceous woman that surrounds the letter.

The post Democrats release suggestive letter to Epstein purportedly signed by Trump, which he denies appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Democrats released a letter to Epstein allegedly signed by Trump, who denies authorship.
The letter includes a suggestive drawing, raising questions about Trump's past associations.
Boston residents may see increased political discourse as the 2024 election approaches.

articles.title: Decades-old mystery solved: Girl identified in New Hampshire serial killer case
articles.description:
The mystery began in 1985 when a hunter discovered the bodies of a woman and 9-year-old girl in a barrel at Bear Brook State Park in Allenstown.

The post Decades-old mystery solved: Girl identified in New Hampshire serial killer case appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Girl identified from 1985 Bear Brook State Park murder case in New Hampshire.
Victims included a woman and a 9-year-old girl, discovered by a hunter.
Resolution may provide closure for families and impact ongoing investigations in Boston.

articles.title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
articles.description:
After nearly 100 years in Rhode Island, the iconic toy maker is making a high-profile move to Massachusetts.

The post Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters from Rhode Island to Boston's Seaport.
The move marks Hasbro's first headquarters change in nearly 100 years.
This relocation is expected to create new jobs and boost the local economy.

articles.title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
articles.description:
A recent poll from Emerson College found that Michelle Wu has expanded her lead over Josh Kraft in the mayoral race.

The post Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Michelle Wu leads Josh Kraft by 50 points in the mayoral race, according to Emerson College poll.
Poll indicates strong support for Wu among Boston residents ahead of the preliminary election.
Implications of Wu's lead could influence voter turnout and campaign strategies in Boston.

articles.title: Dunkin’ franchisee closes down production plant, lays off 74 employees
articles.description:
It is unclear how the closure will affect Dunkin's retail locations.

The post Dunkin’ franchisee closes down production plant, lays off 74 employees appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Dunkin' franchisee closes production plant in Boston, impacting local operations.
74 employees laid off due to the closure, effective immediately.
Uncertainty surrounds the effect on Dunkin's retail locations in the area.

articles.title: Bill Belichick statue at Gillette? Here’s what more than 1,000 readers said.
articles.description:
“He never did anything to endear himself to the fans – why would we want to be reminded of that?”

The post Bill Belichick statue at Gillette? Here’s what more than 1,000 readers said. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Over 1,000 readers shared opinions on a potential Bill Belichick statue at Gillette Stadium.
Many fans expressed negative sentiments, stating he didn't endear himself to them.
The discussion reflects ongoing tensions between Belichick and Boston fans post-Patriots success.

articles.title: Pair from Brighton facing charges in string of handicap placard thefts
articles.description:
The department received reports of at least 19 handicap placard thefts within the Allston-Brighton neighborhood this year.

The post Pair from Brighton facing charges in string of handicap placard thefts appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Two individuals from Brighton charged with stealing handicap placards in Allston-Brighton area.
At least 19 thefts reported in the neighborhood this year.
Local residents face increased difficulty accessing parking due to these thefts.

articles.title: Why did the Patriots abandon the run against the Raiders? Mike Vrabel explains.
articles.description:
"It just wasn't one of our better plays," Vrabel said.

summary: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel criticized the team's running game performance against the Raiders.
Vrabel stated, 'It just wasn't one of our better plays' after the game on September 8.
Boston fans are concerned about the team's offensive strategy affecting future game outcomes.

articles.title: The T’s ‘fare engagement representatives’ are hitting the streets today. Here’s what to expect.
articles.description:
A first offense nets fare evaders a written warning, followed by monetary fines for subsequent offenses.

The post The T’s ‘fare engagement representatives’ are hitting the streets today. Here’s what to expect. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: The MBTA launches fare engagement representatives to address fare evasion starting today.
First-time offenders receive a written warning; subsequent offenses incur monetary fines.
Boston residents may see increased enforcement and potential fines for fare evasion.
